non_residential_details.development_type: Change of Use with Extension(s) over 999sqm

description: Erection of single storey side, first floor rear and single storey rear extensions. A roof extension and use of upper floor as Guest House and division of ground floor into 5 separate units comprising 2 offices, a hairdresser, guest house reception and a restaurant/takeaway.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted (Design and Access Statement, received on 06/12/2013, DUKE OF CAMBRIDGE/PLAN/01, 02, 05, 07 received on 04/11/2013, DUKE OF CAMBRIDGE/PLAN/03, received on 16/12/2013, DUKE OF CAMBRIDGE/PLAN/04, received on 25/11/2013, DUKE OF CAMBRIDGE/PLAN/01, received on 16/12/2013 , DUKE OF CAMBRIDGE/PLAN/08, received on 04/11/2013, DUKE OF CAMBRIDGE/PLAN/09, received on 04/11/2013, DUKE OF CAMBRIDGE/PLAN/10, received on 25/11/2013, DUKE OF CAMBRIDGE/PLAN/11, received on 04/11/2013, Ventilation and Extraction Statement, received on 04/11/2013, Daylight and Sunlight Study, received on 04/11/2013) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.
Condition : 3 - The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the extension hereby permitted shall match those used in the existing building.

Condition : 4 - The first floor of the premises hereby approved shall be used for short term hostel accomodation (a sui generis use) and for no other purpose. No approval is given for the "Manager's Quarters" shown on the approved plans as a seperate self-contained dwelling.
Condition : 5 - The use hereby permitted for the purposes of a restaurant shall not be carried on outside the following times 9:00 a.m. - 11:00 p.m., Monday to Sunday.
Condition : 6 - The short term hostel accommodation component of the use hereby approved shall be restricted to no more than 18 guests at any given time.

Condition : 7 - The "Manager's Quarters" as shown on the approved plans shall be used for no other use than in association with the hostel hereby approved. The "Manager's Quarters" shall not be used as a self-contained dwelling.
Condition : 8 - The windows formed in the side elevation shall be obscure glazed, hinged to open inwards and shall not be repaired or replaced otherwise than with obscured glazing.

Condition : 9 - No additional windows or other glazed openings shall be formed in the side walls of the extension hereby approved and no additional doors inserted in the building without the prior written consent of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 10 - Before any kitchen ventilation is used on the premises, it shall be enclosed with sound-insulating material and mounted in a way which will minimise transmission of structure borne sound in accordance with a scheme to be approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 11 - The use hereby permitted shall not be begun until full particulars and details of a scheme to insulate the premises against the transmission of airborne and impact sound to the adjoining property at No. 5 Kingsley Road, has been submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority and the development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with any approval given.

Condition : 12 - The access doorways to the public house hereby approved shall have a minimum clear width of 900mm, a level surface or ramp between the pavement and the floor and a door handle of not more than 1m above ground level.

Condition : 13 - No development shall take place until details have been submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority for a scheme of acoustic insulation and any associated ventilation to ensure the maximum noise level to be permitted within all bedrooms and the "Manager's Quarters" hereby approved with windows shut and any other necessary means of ventilation provided shall not exceed the "reasonable" limits contained in BS8233:1999. These being LAeq, 16hour = 30 dB in living rooms, and a night (07:00 - 23:00) LAeq, 8hour = 30 dB and LAFmax = 45 dB in bedrooms, and a night LAeq, 1hour = 45 dB in Kitchens, Bathrooms and Utility Rooms.  The details shall be carried out as approved
Condition : 14 - No advertisements shall be installed above the shop front fascia without the prior approval of the Local Planning Authority.
